title: Can I do CA after completing 11th and 12th? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, you can pursue CA after completing 12th by registering in the course through the entrance exam named CA Foundation. Either, if you are not a commerce student, still you can get register for CA Foundation. There are four steps in this course - CA FoundationCA Intermediate3 Years Article ship Training.CA FinalIf you clear all the levels in first attempt then it will take your 4.5 years to become a Chartered Accountant. Although, you can pursue this course even after http://B.com through the Direct Entry Route where you will not have to take the entrance exam, you can directly enroll yourself for the CA Intermediate. But it’s better to start it right after completing 12th as it will save your some precious years.

Yes you can after completing your 12th from any stream. Below are the steps to get into CA course. Complete 12th from any stream be it arts, science or commerce.Apply for CPT ( Entrance exam for CA)Complete http://B.com and then register for CA and directly enroll for IPCC.Advice- Along with Ca, enroll for http://b.com also and once you are through your ipcc take CFA to gain edge over others.

Yes. Go via CPT,IPCC route. Get enrolled under a practising CA and with his consent , do B>Com parallelly..Once aaaaaaaaare you are free from B>COm pay full attention to the CA syallbus and clear the papers in the first attempt.
